item.title: Timothy add a quote by thomas paine
item.description: "Independence is my happiness, and I view things as they are, without regard to place or person; my country is the world, and my religion is to do good." -- thomas paine

item.title: Timothy add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Timothy add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Timothy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Timothy add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong, gives it a superficial appearance of being right, and raises at first a formidable outcry in defense of custom. But the tumult soon subsides. Time makes more converts than reason." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Timothy add a quote by Thomas Paine
item.description: "The Christian religion is a parody on the worship of the sun, in which they put a man called Christ in the place of the sun, and pay him the adoration originally payed to the sun." -- Thomas Paine

item.title: Timothy add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey
